Description: Ovoid jar of black polished Nile silt pottery with small flat base, short tubular handles at the shoulder, deeply pierced after attachment, and a flat ledge rim. Coated with black slip and burnished vertically on body, horizontally around the shoulder.
Curator's comments: Shape like All Black F80F in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Found in a large grave of the late Predynastic period, which contained some vessels of earlier date like this one..
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 69; pl. 34.21)
Condition: fair; salt damage on surface, reconstructed from 2 fragments.
